docs.title: Active Perception in Robotics
docs.description: This document defines active perception, contrasts it with traditional passive perception, highlights its advantages in various robotics applications, and provides concrete examples of its implementation.

next.title: AWS RoboMaker: Cloud-Based Robotics Development and Deployment

docs.title: AWS RoboMaker: Cloud-Based Robotics Development and Deployment
docs.description: This document provides an overview of AWS RoboMaker, Amazon's cloud-based service for robotics developers. RoboMaker extends ROS and ROS 2 with cloud services, enabling large-scale simulation, intelligent robotics functions, and automated deployment.

next.title: Comprehensive Overview of Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics

docs.title: Comprehensive Overview of Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics
docs.description: This document provides a comprehensive overview of the field of Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics, covering its history, key components, state-of-the-art advancements, and future outlook.

previous.title: AWS RoboMaker: Cloud-Based Robotics Development and Deployment

next.title: Vision-Language Models (VLMs): Bridging the Digital Brain with the Physical World

docs.title: Vision-Language Models (VLMs): Bridging the Digital Brain with the Physical World
docs.description: This document explores Vision-Language Models (VLMs), a class of AI that combines the power of large language models with visual understanding. We will delve into their evolution, architecture, key capabilities, and provide a comparison of prominent models.

previous.title: Comprehensive Overview of Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics

next.title: Week 1-2 Assessment: Physical AI and Humanoid Fundamentals

docs.title: Week 1-2 Assessment: Physical AI and Humanoid Fundamentals
docs.description: This document covers the fundamental concepts of physical AI, with a focus on humanoid robotics, their justification, key technologies, and the ethical implications.

previous.title: Vision-Language Models (VLMs): Bridging the Digital Brain with the Physical World

next.title: Weeks 3-5: ROS 2 Fundamentals - Creating a URDF Robot Description

docs.title: Weeks 3-5: ROS 2 Fundamentals - Creating a URDF Robot Description
docs.description: This document provides a comprehensive, in-depth guide to creating a Unified Robot Description Format (URDF) file from scratch. URDF is an essential XML format used in ROS 2 to describe all elements of a robot model. By the end of this tutorial, you will have a complete URDF for a simple wheeled robot and a deep understanding of each component.

previous.title: Week 1-2 Assessment: Physical AI and Humanoid Fundamentals

next.title: Weeks 8-10: Advanced Simulation with Isaac Sim & the Sim-to-Real Challenge

docs.title: Weeks 8-10: Advanced Simulation with Isaac Sim & the Sim-to-Real Challenge
docs.description: This document introduces NVIDIA's Isaac Sim and explores the critical robotics concept of "Sim-to-Real." We'll discuss why it's a major challenge and the strategies used to overcome it, particularly with advanced simulators like Isaac Sim.

previous.title: Weeks 3-5: ROS 2 Fundamentals - Creating a URDF Robot Description

next.title: Weeks 11-12: Capstone Project - Humanoid Butler Bot

docs.title: Weeks 11-12: Capstone Project - Humanoid Butler Bot
docs.description: This document outlines the capstone project for the humanoid development course. The goal is to integrate all the concepts learned in the previous weeks—from robot description and control to simulation and AI—to build a simulated "Butler Bot." This robot will be capable of navigating a home environment, perceiving objects, and performing a simple fetch-and-carry task.

previous.title: Weeks 8-10: Advanced Simulation with Isaac Sim & the Sim-to-Real Challenge

next.title: Week 13: Conversational AI - Multimodal Interfaces for Human-Robot Interaction

docs.title: Week 13: Conversational AI - Multimodal Interfaces for Human-Robot Interaction
docs.description: This document explores the concept of multimodal interfaces in the context of human-robot interaction, combining speech with other modalities like vision, gestures, and haptics to create more natural and intuitive communication channels.

previous.title: Weeks 11-12: Capstone Project - Humanoid Butler Bot

next.title: Week 13: Conversational AI - Speech-to-Text with Whisper

docs.title: Week 13: Conversational AI - Speech-to-Text with Whisper
docs.description: This guide explains how to integrate a powerful speech-to-text (STT) model, OpenAI's Whisper, into a ROS 2 application. This will allow our robot to understand voice commands from a user.

previous.title: Week 13: Conversational AI - Multimodal Interfaces for Human-Robot Interaction

next.title: Why Robotics? A Deep Dive into the Motivation and Impact

docs.title: Why Robotics? A Deep Dive into the Motivation and Impact
docs.description: This document explores the fundamental reasons driving the relentless pursuit of advancements in robotics. From societal benefits to economic transformation and scientific exploration, robotics stands as a pivotal field shaping the future.

previous.title: Week 13: Conversational AI - Speech-to-Text with Whisper

metadata.title: An Introduction to Humanoid Robotics
metadata.description: Humanoid robotics is a fascinating field that focuses on creating robots with human-like capabilities and appearance. These robots are designed to interact with and assist humans in a variety of tasks, from healthcare and manufacturing to entertainment and companionship.

blogPosts.content:
Humanoid robotics is a fascinating field that focuses on creating robots with human-like capabilities and appearance. These robots are designed to interact with and assist humans in a variety of tasks, from healthcare and manufacturing to entertainment and companionship.

In this blog, we will explore the latest advancements in humanoid robotics, discuss the challenges and opportunities in this field, and showcase some of the most innovative projects from around the world.

default.title: Markdown page example
default.description: You don't need React to write simple standalone pages.
